title: Cardano Music Streaming Dapp
description: The music business infrastructure is bloated and its hard to discover global artists. Also, how do we onboard the gen population to Cardano?

f6_assessments.q0: Very cool idea that could actually compete with platforms like Spotify in the long run. The aspect of paying seeders to keep up the network availability is an interesting take on a durable economic model. What will be a challenge, though is how this would compete with free versions of other platforms.
f6_assessments.q1:
The price for a monthly subscription is fair and competitive. On the music industry side of this project, the proposer has relevant experience and claims of contact with developers to create this platform. It would've been nice to see some more information about these developers in the proposal to better be able to assess the feasibility of success; there is no mention of who would design the frontend DApp. 
On the other hand, having 2 major music labels already showing interest, of which one already committing, is a good sign.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan is elaborately laid out and the roadmap is clear on the 3 - 6 -12 month scale. Yet there are 2 things that are not very clear: How you would compete with other platforms. And why there is a request for 60K USD when the development cost is set at 30K USD. So the funding needs to be broken down more to justify the amount.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a major problem that needs solving and you are solving a few other problems as well. Excellent idea for incentivising peers for sharing songs. Incentives for people to share music to cover costs of servers and potetially degen piracy. This project can look quite delicious for many parties and drive more people to use Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: With a dedicated plutus dev on the team and a potential label or 2 interested things are looking bright for this project. Sensible plan, but would want to see the budget broken down into identifiable items. I would ad a little more info about the devs that will develope this. People need to see what you are capable of in order to gain trust. Also it helps to have the whole team onboard before getting funded. People need to see the front and backend developer's skills in action.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposal has a clear roadmap that seems sensible including performance indicators. The solution to cutting out all the middlemen in the music industry and potentially slowing down piracy is very clear and attractive. Here's a potential problem though... 
Why would an Indie artist sign with a label if they would then have to give a cut of their income to the label. I suppose the label will get them more listeners in the end so it would balance out. Maybe the platform will have to evolve to meet everybody's needs. In that case, people should be able to vote on this.

f6_assessments.q0:
- This idea is amazing. It truly has the potential to reduce the piracy and reduce the cost altogether.
- This, as said, could be adopted globally by several labels and artists around the world.
f6_assessments.q1: - I really think that this project worth the price but there are a few things that should be included in order to allow us to verify the feasibility: a) The price that will be charged for the pay-per-streaming  method (it must be shown). Also, you must consider the price variation in different countries, e.g. the price in the spotify US, which is $ 9,99, is quite different from the price in Brazil, which is $ 3,9; b) As said, there are various participants in the production of a music, meaning that the Dapp must pay several parties. Therefore, adding an easy method for the label upload the music or the album adding the wallets of whoever needs to receive.
f6_assessments.q2: - One point that should be better explained is the $60K budget. Half of it is allocated to the development, and the other half?

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal adequately addresses the need to build a decentralized music platform that allows fans to pay-per-stream and artists to sell their music. DSP on blockchain is a great idea!
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's experience is the music business is indisputable. However, implementing this on the blockchain using only one PLUTUS developer leaves a doubt on ETA.
f6_assessments.q2: Information provided is not enough to justify the asking fund of 60k. I'll rate auditability 3/5

f6_assessments.q0: This is a high-level proposal that addresses a challenge already being addressed by large corporations such as Apple and Spotify - there is also Audius in the.Blockchain arena with a similar product. The music business infrastructure is bloated and its hard to discover New global artists. Proposer wants to build a decentralized music platform for the world. Fans pay-per-stream. Artists get paid more & quicker; they'll use it to sell music.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is backed by a great deal of experience - 20 years in music business. The main challenge will not be with the creation of the final product, but with the ongoing marketing and advertising to attract users. People currently have a plethora of choices for their music, and many have spent hundreds or thousands of dollars on their current platform of choice (Apple, Spotify, etc).
f6_assessments.q2:
The challenge for this proposal will be obtaining talented developers to implement the proposer's vision. The timeline seems a bit ambitious, as most Minimal Viable Products (MVP) take 90+ days to implement.

3 month goal - Launch MVP.

6 month goal - Streaming Music Labels

12 month goal - Scale - the most difficult metric to audit and verify. The product may be amazing, but the budget to advertise and attract users may be significant.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal presents the inspiring side of dApps to create apps to revolutionize a sector in the world. The creation of this dApp would make sure music artists all over the world get paid fairly. It also cuts out the multiple middlemen involved.  It's a perfect representation of what the challenge embodies. It would inevitably create an incentive for people to start using ADA through this platform.
f6_assessments.q1: Reading the proposal you can clearly see the experience the proposer has. The fact that he went and recruited a developer within the community who was a member of the Plutus program is a great sign that shows he is well active with the proposal. The company from the proposer has a red flag for me, the company was established in 2011 yet the link provided to the company is an adobe spark website. The website provided on the social media platform to the company gets a 404. The proposal is also missing a budget breakdown which doesn't clarify why they need the 60 000. I can get behind the 30.000 needed to develop a music platform however that still leaves 30.000 unexplained. The proposer stated that he has a plan to make sure every major label will use the platform but doesn't really give a hint as to how he plans it. Two major record labels are already interested and the proposer has a commitment from a record label but doesn't give facts on which record labels these are. Considering the information that is lacking I can't say this proposal will be implemented successfully, so i neither agree nor disagree.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has stated goals to achieve but other than that there isn't much to go by in terms of auditability. It's missing a funding breakdown where and details about the development of the app. They declare that it takes 2 months to develop the platform, but is this purely coding the dApp, or does this included stress testing and security audit of the dApp? Including KPI's in the proposal would also benefit the auditability of the proposal, on which factor do you criticize the success of the dApp?

solution: Build a decentralized music platform for the world. Fans pay-per-stream. Artists get paid more & quicker; they'll use it to sell records.
experience: 20 years in music business.  Tech Startup exp. Connected.  I have a plan to get every major label to use this. Then Africa. Then the world.
